title: How to Care for the Rubber Seal of a Pressure Cooker

steps.headline: After removing the lid from the pressure cooker, run cold water over the rubber ring.
steps.description: This will harden it, which helps to prevent further damage.

steps.headline: Wash the ring separately from the lid.
steps.description: This will reduce the pressure on the rubber ring.

steps.headline: Air dry the rubber ring on a drying rack.
steps.description: Allow for circulation of air around the whole ring.

steps.headline: Store the ring separately from the lid.
steps.description: Before storing, ensure that the rubber ring is completely dry.

steps.headline: Replace the rubber seals once they have deteriorated.
steps.description: This is to ensure your safety as well as efficient cooking.

text: After removing the lid from the pressure cooker, run cold water over the rubber ring. This will harden it, which helps to prevent further damage. Wash the ring separately from the lid. This will reduce the pressure on the rubber ring. Air dry the rubber ring on a drying rack. Allow for circulation of air around the whole ring. Store the ring separately from the lid. Before storing, ensure that the rubber ring is completely dry. Replace the rubber seals once they have deteriorated. This is to ensure your safety as well as efficient cooking.
